goal.parser

Interface EmbeddedKRParser


  • public interface EmbeddedKRParser
    This is the interface for embedded KR language parsers. The embedded parser must be compatible with the ANTLR parser that GOAL uses, since we are using hard linking of the parsers to the ANTLRReaderStream that the constructor takes. The constructor usually takes this form:
    public EmbeddedXXXParser(ANTLRReaderStream cs, File sourceFile)

    Error handling

    By default, antlr parsers catch and try to recover from RecognitionException. However, embedded parsers operate on a stream that fits more widely in a GOAL parser. Therefore, the parser is expected to interpret unexpected tokens as if the end-of-input was encountered. CHECK lexer hacks to deal with '}' '.' and ')'??

    GOAL provides a number of extensions to such RecognitionException, eg ParserException and InvalidSemanticsException. Such exceptions are to be caught by the embedded parser (by setting up ANTLR properly). InvalidSemanticsException occurs usually as a post-check on a parsed segment and therefore often is generated after the ANTLR parser has done its job. In that case this exception must still be caught and reported.

    Author:
    W.Pasman 15sep2011
